data.content: Attack determination: No Attack (clean scenario). Justification: BWT (-5.11 pp) aligns with clean/uniform expectations and is well above poisoned thresholds; last-task and average accuracies are stable with no broad, uniform declines; per-task accuracies remain far above chance and forgetting patterns are typical for EWC. No indicators of Brainwash, Accumulative Attack, or Label Flipping are present at this stage.

{"summary": "Attack determination: No Attack (clean scenario). Justification: BWT (-5.11 pp) aligns with clean/uniform expectations and is well above poisoned thresholds; last-task and average accuracies are stable with no broad, uniform declines; per-task accuracies remain far above chance and forgetting patterns are typical for EWC. No indicators of Brainwash, Accumulative Attack, or Label Flipping are present at this stage."}

Attack determination: No Attack (clean scenario). Justification: The optimization behavior during Task 8 is consistent with clean EWC training—per-component losses increase briefly at task start then converge back to the same low levels observed at the end of Task 7, with no persistent instability or degradation. The extremely large, unlogged portion of the total loss appears to be a stable regularization term (e.g., EWC penalty) present across tasks rather than an attack effect. There is no evidence of the hallmark drops in BWT or last-task accuracy required to attribute Brainwash, nor patterns indicative of Accumulative Attack (progressive cross-task degradation) or Label Flipping (sustained high task loss). Accordingly, this step is assessed as clean; proceed to compute BWT and last-task accuracy next to confirm.

Attack determination: Brainwash. The step executed a BrainWash routine explicitly (--mode='reckless') and exhibited hallmark symptoms: an early catastrophic loss spike with a negligible stability penalty (loss_bn share ≈ 8.8e−5), followed by convergence to a low-accuracy plateau. The last-task accuracy collapsed to 36.0%, which is a −32.3 point deviation from clean EWC (68.3%) and even worse than reported BrainWash baselines (51.0–58.8%). Training stagnated over the final epochs (acc_target −0.4 pts; mean_traj_loss nearly constant), and current-task accuracy hovered near 15%, indicating poisoned optimization rather than normal EWC behavior. While BWT cannot be computed without per-task accuracies, the command-line configuration and the severe last-task crash decisively confirm a Brainwash attack at this stage.

Attack determination: Brainwash. Final evaluation confirms severe poisoning-induced collapse: BWT deteriorated from -1.74 pp to -47.86 pp (Δ -46.12 pp), old-task average accuracy fell to chance-level 10.02%, and last-task accuracy is 46.0%, below reported BrainWash baselines for EWC on CIFAR-100. Loss spikes and near-zero retention on prior tasks corroborate a reckless Brainwash pattern. No indicators of Accumulative Attack or Label Flipping are present.
